desc: Count to 100 by ones and by tens.
Count forward beginning from a given number within the known sequence.
Write numbers from 0 to 20. Represent a number of objects with a written numeral.
Represent addition and subtraction with objects, fingers, mental images, etc.
Fluently add and subtract within 5.
Use addition and subtraction within 20 to solve word problems.
Add and subtract within 20.
Add within 100 including adding a two-digit number and a one-digit number.
Use addition and subtraction within 100 to solve one- and two-step word problems.
Fluently add and subtract within 100 using strategies based on place value.
Add and subtract within 1000 using concrete models, drawings, and strategies.
Use multiplication and division within 100 to solve word problems.
Fluently multiply and divide within 100.
Fluently add and subtract within 1000 using strategies based on place value.
Solve multistep word problems posed with whole numbers using the four operations.
Fluently add and subtract multi-digit whole numbers using an algorithm.
Multiply whole numbers (up to four digit by one-digit and two-digit by two-digit).
Fluently multiply multi-digit whole numbers using an algorithm.
Operations with decimals to hundredths (add, subtract, multiply and divide).
Efficiently add and subtract fractions with unlike denominators.
Understand the concept of a ratio and use ratio language.
Fluently divide multi-digit numbers using an algorithm.
Fluently add, subtract, multiply and divide multi-digit decimals.
Demonstrate understanding of the organization and basic features of print.
Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills in decoding words.
Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills in decoding words.
With prompting and support, ask and answer explicit questions about key ideas and details.
Read fluently (accuracy, speed and prosody) on grade-level to support comprehension.
Ask and answer questions such as who, what, where, when, why, and how to construct meaning.
Know and apply grade-level phonics (decode multisyllabic words, Latin suffixes).
Identify and cite relevant implicit and explicit information to determine the central idea.
Refer to details and examples in a text when explaining what the text says explicitly.
Analyze how the central ideas are reflected in a text, and cite relevant implicit and explicit evidence.
Cite textual evidence to support analysis of what the text says explicitly as well as inferences.
Compose opinion pieces, using drawing, dictating, and writing to state the topic and an opinion.
Compose narratives to develop real or imagined experiences with clear sequences.
Compose opinion pieces on topics or texts, with supporting reasons.
Compose informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and provide information.
Compose opinions supporting an author's perspective with reasons and information.
Compose informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas clearly.
Compose arguments to support claims with clear reasons and relevant evidence.
